pullRequest.body:
Consider a multilinear map `f : E^n -> F`. Then its `k`-th derivative can be written as follows, given a basepoint `x : E^n` and `k` vectors `v_1, ..., v_k : E^n`:
```
D^k f (x; v_1, ..., v_k) = \sum f (x_1, (v_{e.symm 2})_2, x_3, ..., (v_{e.symm n))_n)
```
where in the sum at each index `i` one uses either the `i`-th coordinate of `x`, or the `i`-th coordinate of one of the vectors `v_j`, and each `v_j` has to appear exactly once in this expression. The sum is parameterized by the embeddings `e` of `Fin k` in `Fin n`.

This expression is a little bit cumbersome to write down and to use, but it gives nice explicit bounds on `||D^k f||` that are useful to study Fourier transforms. 

The PR introduces the formal definition of each term in the sum (as an object which is multilinear in the coordinates of `x` outside the range of `e`, and in the `v_j`), and then proves that the sum is indeed the iterated derivative of `f`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9002431551/job/24730721272)

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9002431551/job/24730720565)
I've left some comments, most of which are golf / pedantry â€“Â the overall design looks spot-on.

Do you expect this lemma to be useful outside the context of this particular proof? If so, I think it might be better to move it somewhere else â€“ probably the same place that `embeddingFinSucc` is defined. If not, perhaps it should be `private`-ized?

Rather than repeating the proof of `domDomRestrict_aux`, one can deduce it from the statement with P replaced by not-P, as follows:
```suggestion
  simpa only [dite_not] using domDomRestrict_aux _ z (fun j â†¦ x âŸ¨j.1, not_not.mp j.2âŸ©) i c
```
Perhaps this can be inlined in the 2 places where the lemma is used (I did not try).
Maybe it is a good idea to say explicitly in the docstring that this is a linear-map version of the function `domDomRestrict`. Also `a multilinear map` (singular).
line break
I didn't get this one. What do you suggest?
Just that the line break after `them` is oddly positioned.
Fixed, thanks!

golf:
```suggestion
  rcases eq_or_ne i (e.symm i_1) with rfl | hne
  Â· rw [Equiv.apply_symm_apply e i_1, update_same, update_same]
  Â· rw [update_noteq hne.symm, update_noteq fun h â†¦ (Equiv.symm_apply_apply .. â–¸ h â–¸ hne) rfl]
```

`i` is used as a generic element of `Î¹` but also a generic element of `Î±`, perhaps the latter should be `a`? Also it seems a pity to write `i_1` given that we have these lovely unicode subscripts :smile:
cardinality
"where" nested within "where" seems clumsy; suggest "or one of ..., **and** each ...". See remark on "cardinal" below
(As a remark, it's a pity that we don't have a `pick_goals` tactic which can pick more than one goal and solve those in parallel.)

```suggestion
  (f.toMultilinearMap.iteratedFDerivComponent e).mkContinuousMultilinear â€–fâ€– <| by
```

This still seems to work without providing `F` explicitly (it is slightly slower, but only a couple of %). One can also inline the `have`, i.e.
```suggestion
      rw [prod_subtype _ (fun _ â†¦ s.mem_toFinset), â† Equiv.prod_comp e.symm]
```

```suggestion
â€–f.iteratedFDerivComponent e (x Â·)â€– â‰¤ â€–fâ€– * â€–xâ€– ^ (Fintype.card Î¹ - Fintype.card Î±) := calc
```
(same abbreviation "`(x Â·)`" for "`(fun i â†¦ x i)`" could be applied in several other places)

typo?
```suggestion
      Â· exact fun i _ â†¦ norm_nonneg _
```
(& same 2 lines up)
Is there a reason for `apply` here given `exact` would work?

formatting:
```suggestion
  calc â€–f.iteratedFDeriv k xâ€–
  _ â‰¤ âˆ‘ e : Fin k â†ª Î¹, â€–iteratedFDerivComponent f e.toEquivRange (fun i â†¦ x i)â€– := norm_sum_le _ _
```

```suggestion
  _ â‰¤ âˆ‘ _ : Fin k â†ª Î¹, â€–fâ€– * â€–xâ€– ^ (Fintype.card Î¹ - k) := by
```
and again
Again, `_hn` can be completely anonymized and I wonder if that is what you intended
this line can be omitted (it is slightly slower without, but the difference is smaller than would be obtained by squeezing the `simp` in the next line)
these two can be merged

golf:
```suggestion
  Â·   exact fun _ _ â†¦ continuous_finset_sum _ (fun _ _ â†¦ 
      (ContinuousMultilinearMap.coe_continuous _).comp (ContinuousLinearMap.continuous _))
```
Looks a little bit less readable to me, so I'll keep the original version.

```suggestion
    iteratedFDeriv ð•œ n f = f.iteratedFDeriv n :=
  funext fun x â†¦ (f.hasFTaylorSeriesUpTo_iteratedFDeriv.eq_iteratedFDeriv le_top x).symm
```
(the next lemma can similarly be golfed slightly into a term-mode proof)

This harmless-looking `ext` seems to take an inordinately long time. There is a typeclass synthesis wild-goose-chase going on with `Module ð•œ (ContinuousMultilinearMap ð•œ (fun i â†¦ (i : Î¹) â†’ E i) F)`. It is far from being the slowest step in this proof, but it's still not ideal.
Agreed.

```suggestion
      split_ifs with hkf
      Â· simp only [â† Equiv.succ_embeddingFinSucc_fst_symm_apply e hkf hke, Fin.cons_succ]
      Â· obtain rfl : k = e 0 := by
```

```suggestion
          Pi.compRightL_apply]
```

```suggestion
      rw [show k = _ from Subtype.ext_iff_val.1 hke, Equiv.embeddingFinSucc_snd e]
```
